owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

params._module: The address of the module associated with the integration
params._name: Human readable string identifying the integration

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

devdoc.title: IntegrationRegistry The IntegrationRegistry holds state relating to the Modules and the integrations they are connected with. The state is combined into a single Registry to allow governance updates to be aggregated to one contract.

addIntegration(address,string,address).notice: GOVERNANCE FUNCTION: Add a new integration to the registry

batchAddIntegration(address[],string[],a.notice: GOVERNANCE FUNCTION: Batch add new adapters. Reverts if exists on any module and name

batchEditIntegration(address[],string[],.notice: GOVERNANCE FUNCTION: Batch edit adapters for modules. Reverts if module and adapter name don't map to an adapter address

editIntegration(address,string,address).notice: GOVERNANCE FUNCTION: Edit an existing integration on the registry

getIntegrationAdapter(address,string).notice: Get integration adapter address associated with passed human readable name

getIntegrationAdapterWithHash(address,by.notice: Get integration adapter address associated with passed hashed name

isValidIntegration(address,string).notice: Check if adapter name is valid

removeIntegration(address,string).notice: GOVERNANCE FUNCTION: Remove an existing integration on the registry
